file_content.text: You think you are clever for fooling Aulus G'luun and the rest of the Gand?
Should mind temper, Gand.
He will not break his promise to Lars Baddeg or to his brothers--to keep the holocron from the Jedi.
Lars Baddeg is a criminal. He stole the holocron from the Jedi.
Lars is a thief.
You speak of laws. The Republic's laws have no respect for the Gand culture or traditions.
Their barricade has trapped the Gand here like animals, among the criminals of the Migrant Merchants' Guild.
My order wasn't responsible for the barricade.
That's not the Jedi's fault.
That is no concern of Aulus G'luun. If you refuse to help, then you are no better than the Republic that enforces the unjust laws.
Will you give me the holocron if I promise to get the barricade removed?
So allow me to help.
Is there nothing I can do to convince you to give me the holocron?
We have to resolve this.
Only lifting the barricade. But if he gives you the holocron, Aulus G'luun cannot trust you to do it.
I have no choice but to kill you.
Then you die. [Attack]
If I promise to help stop this injustice, will you give me the holocron?
I should right this wrong.
Lars Baddeg promised the same thing to the Gand... but he has not kept his promise yet.
Why should Aulus G'luun trust anyone who is not a Gand?
My order has a reputation of trust to uphold.
I am a Jedi.
Your order means nothing to Aulus G'luun or the Gand. Why has your order not tried to help us before?
No, he thinks he will stick with Lars Baddeg and defend the holocron!
You're stuck behind this barricade. You can only gain by trusting me.
You have nothing to lose.
It is true that Aulus G'luun is out of alternatives for the Gand.
But he must be sure. Aulus G'luun will go to the Republic officer at the barricade, with your promise. He will see for himself.
You spoke truthfully. The Republic officer has agreed to remove the barricade, at your word.
You are a truer friend to the Gand than Lars Baddeg. The holocron is yours.
May you always conquer your enemies.
I will take the Noetikon by force if I must.
The alternative is combat.
You and the Gand must have done something.
Nobody is wholly innocent.
Aulus G'luun will not permit you to attack the Gand's honor! You will pay for your cowardly words!
Give me the holocron.
[Force Persuade] Hand it over.
Aulus G'luun will give you the holocron.
I appreciate it.
Excellent.
All done, then.
Aulus G'luun is honored to help. He does not know what Lars Baddeg's concern is with this holocron.
Is no matter. Is good thing you do.
Aulus G'luun wishes you good fortune. May you always conquer your enemies.
Yuon will die without the holocron. I won't let you keep it.
I must save Yuon. [Attack]
Aulus G'luun will see about that.
